Reporting of HSSE Statistics & lncidents
The purpose of this Bulletin is to clarify the reporting requirements for the JIG Airport JV
locations and to advise them of some changes to the incident definitions.
Background
The reporting of JV incident statistics is a requirement of all JIG Member Companies.
The HSSE reporting system on the JIG website was established to provide:
o An incident reporting log and a means to generate statistics for each JV and for the
total of allthe JV locations.
o A means to collate JV HSSE statistics in order to identify trends and allow
comparison between JVs.
Enhancements to the current system
Incident Reportinq
JVs are encouraged to report individual incidents using the incident reporting log within the
HSSE reporting system on the JIG website. However, it is recognised that only a minority of
JVs are currently using the JIG incident reporting log because most have an alternative
incident reporting system available to them, particularly those JVs which are managed by
one of the major JIG Member Companies. This is acceptable provided that the HSSE
statistics reporting requirements described below are followed.
The JIG HSSE reporting system has been modified to allow for reporting of statistics without
the need to use the incident reporting log. For those JVs curently using the incident

The JIG HSSE reporting system has been modified to allow for reporting of statistics without
the need to use the incident reporting log. For those JVs curently using the incident
reporting log this functionality remains active. The functionality has however been removed
for all other JVs (but can be reinstated on request).
HSSE Monthly Statistics Reporting
Currently HSSE statistics are prepared by the JVs using the HSSE Quarterly Performance
Statistics Forms or the JIG web-based HSSE reporting system. Ihis data is collated by JlG.
JIG now requires monthly HSSE statistics to be reported using the JIG web-based HSSE
reporting system only.
Each JV should add its total volume, hours worked and total (into-plane) fuellings information
to the Ops Monthly Statistics Page. The JVs not using the incident reporting log should
additionally enter their incident data to the HSSE Monthly Statistics Page.
Note: A quarterly summary (similar in appearance to the existing JIG Quarterly Performance
Statistics paper format) is automatically generated from the reported data. This can be
copied and pasted to a word document if required (for example for those who need to
provide this information to local shareholders). To produce an Excel Worksheet, place the
mouse pointer on the table and select "export to Excel".

Chanqes to lncident Definitions
The distinction between depot and into-plane spills and hours worked is removed and there
is a revised definition lor Fuelling Vehicle lncident. These changes bring JIG closer to the
majority of JIG Member Company reporting definitions. The cunent incident definitions are
shown on the JIG website.
Action Required by JVs
Effective January 2010, the following actions need to be implemented
lncident Reportino - Each JIG Airport JV to decide if they will use the JIG incident
reporting log or use an alternative incident reporting system as approved by the
participant companies, and to ensure that the necessary processes are in place.
